Hi,

As a reminder, I'm working on the validation of data migration between two database
schemas.

I have used Hibernate (www.hibernate.org) to map Java objects to my
two databases and now I'm starting to work on Junit testing.
With hibernate, it is possible to iterate over objects. My idea is that
I'll iterate over the "root" object from the source database, and
compare the data to the destination database. I thought to design
fixtures to test each instance of object. 

Let's say my root object is of type Customer, and that we also have
Orders linked to the customers (many orders for 1 customer)

Here's the logic I would follow:

hibernate.iterate(Customer)
{
	customer=nextcustomer
	testCustomer(customer)
}

and testCustomer would look like
testCustomer(customer)
{
	newCustomer=newDatabase.getcustomer(customer.getCustomerId())
	assetEquals(customer;newCustomer);
	compareOrders(customer.getOrders(), newCustomer.getOrders());
}


Is that the right way to go?
How do I translate that in Junit code? Do I write a class CustomerTest
and a class OrderTest that extend TestCase? Would I then use a fixture whose
setUp method takes an argument (customer id, order id)? Is that even
possible or should I use Unitee?

I'm discovering Junit and eventually will certainly be able to find some
answers, but I'd really appreciate any help getting me faster on track
and validating my approach!!

Thanks.

Raph
subject: fixture with parameter passed + other things
